title: Wish: Restore the active viewport to its original state
question:
While “Shift + Ctrl + dragging with the mouse” rotates an ortographic viewport, I’m unable to restore the original state of the viewport without the 
'_4View
 or 
'_4View ZEA
 commands (assuming I don’t want to delete all the viewport manipulation history be pressing or holding the Home key).

What if pressing “Shift + Ctrl + 0” is used to restore the active viewport to its original state, while pressing the Home key returns to the last state and the viewport manipulation history is still there? Is there a way to do that already?

code_blocks.code:
! _-RunPythonScript (
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
crntFile = rs.DocumentPath()
if  crntFile:
    path = crntFile + rs.DocumentName()
    cmdStr = "_-ReadViewportsFromFile " + chr(34) + path + chr(34) + " _Enter"
    rs.Command(cmdStr, False)
)
code_blocks.author: pascal

code_blocks.code:
! _-RunPythonScript (
import rhinoscriptsyntax as rs
temps = rs.TemplateFolder()
working = rs.WorkingFolder()
rs.WorkingFolder(temps)
cmdStr = "_ReadViewportsFromFile "
rs.Command(cmdStr, False)
rs.WorkingFolder(working)
)
